intro: [WRONG START] Salvia officinalus f. adenostachys, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sage, is a botanical variant of the common sage plant. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and compact growth habit. This form is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and ornamental value in gardens. The plant is native to southern Europe and thrives in well-drained soils and sunny conditions. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
